content: Great game. Easily worth $4.99 for the full experience. Making this game and the player focus on time and resource management, has created a survival game which challenges, rewards, intrigues, frustrates, pampers, horrifies, and yet still pacifies. A decent and thought provoking story line with 8 or more decision based endings. Some horrific; some hopeful. Extensive tech tree and crafting. Random world map locations w/ resource location realism. A COMPLETE INDIE GAME. BUY IT NOW, THANK ME LATER

content: I actually FINISHED this game, which is saying something. It's that good. No "done with this quest, now immediately do this quest" (I hate that).. you get to explore. NO IN YOUR FACE MICRO TRANSACTIONS! I dont love crafting, but crafting and resource management is fun, the right kind of challenging & makes sense in this game. Killing and gathering doesnt feel like grinding.. It "feels" like an apocalypse.

replyContent: Hello there. This is actually a punishment mechanism for games. content: Even on highest settings the graphics are dull and muddy. It has some fun mechanics, but it's unbalanced and repetitive. Suggestions: 1. Make more options available for vigor such as more crafting options and food items. Beds and stims aren't sufficient. 2. If we can make a stove, we can certainly make an icebox to increase food longevity. Greenhouse is not enough on its own for food. 3. Allow for a zoom-in feature to allow for greater immersion. Of course I increased brightness. How insulting.
replyContent:
1. Please adjust the brightness of the phone itself. 2. Use the NPC trading system in the game.

content: One of the best games I've played. No pay to win mechanics in the game. You don't have to start the whole game over if you die. It has a story line, the controls and graphics are good...

content: why does everytime I need to play game is I need to log in and it requires internet connection..It sucks that I cannot play when I have no mobile data..make it so we can play it offline directly..

content: My issue with the survival stats system (Health/Vitality/Hungry/Mood) is that once it fully depletes, your character faints and it reload your recent save, in my case, in my base with low stats. content: i normally don't play zomebie games that requires internet i must say that i couldn't resist spending a dime just to play a real great zombie survivor game.. now I've had a few login errors and its pretty hard getting use to it because its a online zombie game and I'm still giving it a chance.. I have to get a refund because I don't have enough space on my phone but I'll definitely re-buy it soon when I get another phone.. can't wait to play this again soon
replyContent: Once purchased, the purchase history will be saved in your GOOGLE PLAY account. Even if you change your phone, you won't be asked to pay again.At the start of the game, GOOGLE PLAY needs INTERNET to detect the account purchase record, in order to determine the authorization. During the game, you don't need to use INTERNET.

content: Early stages in the game, looks promising so far. The one big downside is terrible English in the story dialogs which is not surprising for anything coming out of China. Also why exactly do you need phone, call permissions? p.s you can't save on demand or know when a save file is created...
replyContent: Thank you for supporting us. We now have native American players who are helping us with proofreading in English. Because they are volunteers, it will take more time to do. Google play needs phone permission to check to verify the purchase history. This is to prevent piracy and cracking and protect the interests of real purchasers.
